meanings.sent1: She worked hard to attain her dream of becoming a doctor.
meanings.sent2: He finally attained his goal of running a marathon.
meanings.sent3: After years of practice, she was able to attain her black belt in karate.
meanings.sent4: With determination, one can attain any goal they set their mind to.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of accomplishment when you attain a difficult task is truly rewarding.

meanings.definition: To reach or arrive at a certain point or level
meanings.sent1: The hiker was thrilled to attain the mountain peak after a long climb.
meanings.sent2: The rocket will attain orbit around the Earth in just a few minutes.
meanings.sent3: It took hours, but the cat finally managed to attain the top of the tree.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's speed allowed him to attain the finish line first.
meanings.sent5: The balloon will attain a height of 100 feet before descending back to the ground.

meanings.definition: To gain or acquire something, especially through effort or skill
meanings.sent1: Through hard work, she was able to attain a scholarship for college.
meanings.sent2: He hoped to attain enough knowledge to pass the exam.
meanings.sent3: The detective was determined to attain the truth behind the mysterious case.
meanings.sent4: With practice, one can attain fluency in a new language.
meanings.sent5: The artist's dedication allowed her to attain mastery in painting.
